page.title: 10Crops - Wheat and Barley
page.content: In the Dunmow area wheat and barley are the most popular crops. Wheat is grown in large quantities because its grain is needed to make cereals, flour for bread and biscuits. Barley is used as animal fodder and for making malt for the brewing industry. To ensure successful yields farmers use chemicals against insects and diseases. 'Smut' is a fungus which changes the kernel into black powder, and 'rust' causes red or black patches on the stems or leaves. The weather is good for both crops since there is plenty of sunshine in Summer to help them ripen quickly. Over 3 tons of grain per acre is produced, and often there is a surplus. This year some of this has been sent to the starving people of Ethiopia.
